problem_text: Find the perimeter of \triangle CPD if the perimeter of \triangle BPA is 12, AP = \sqrt{13}, and DP = 3\sqrt{13}.
logic_forms: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(C, D, N)), MeasureOf(Angle(B, A, M)))
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠ADC, 10.82 = 3 * SqrtOf(13), ∠BAD, ∠CBA, ∠CDP, ∠DAB, ∠CDA, M on AP, M on AN, ∠NAB, N on DP, P on BC, ∠BAN, ∠PAB, P on AD, 3 * SqrtOf(13) = DP, 12 = Perimeter(△ABP), ∠BAM = ∠CDN, N on AD, ∠BCD, SqrtOf(13) = AP, ∠PDC

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : M on AN, ∠NAB
Conclusions: ∠MAB = ∠NAB

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CDP, N on DP
Conclusions: ∠CDN = ∠CDP

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : P on BC, ∠CBA
Conclusions: ∠CBA = ∠PBA

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : M on AN, ∠BAN
Conclusions: ∠BAM = ∠BAN

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : M on AP, ∠PAB
Conclusions: ∠MAB = ∠PAB

Step 7:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : P on AD, P on BC
Conclusions: ∠BPA = ∠CPD

Step 8:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 10.82 = 3 * SqrtOf(13), 3 * SqrtOf(13) = DP
Conclusions: 10.82 = DP

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BAD, N on AD
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠BAN

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : N on AD, ∠ADC
Conclusions: ∠ADC = ∠NDC

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : N on AD, ∠CDA
Conclusions: ∠CDA = ∠CDN

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DAB, N on AD
Conclusions: ∠DAB = ∠NAB

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : P on BC, ∠BCD
Conclusions: ∠BCD = ∠PCD

Step 14:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : SqrtOf(13) = AP
Conclusions: 3.61 = AP

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠PDC, N on DP
Conclusions: ∠NDC = ∠PDC

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CDN = ∠CDP, ∠BAM = ∠CDN
Conclusions: ∠BAM = ∠CDP

Step 17:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠MAB = ∠PAB, ∠MAB = ∠NAB
Conclusions: ∠NAB = ∠PAB

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠NDC = ∠PDC, ∠ADC = ∠NDC
Conclusions: ∠ADC = ∠PDC

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BAM = ∠CDP, ∠BAM = ∠BAN
Conclusions: ∠BAN = ∠CDP

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DAB = ∠NAB, ∠NAB = ∠PAB
Conclusions: ∠DAB = ∠PAB

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BAD = ∠BAN, ∠BAN = ∠CDP
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠CDP

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CDA = ∠CDN, ∠BAD = ∠CDP, ∠CDN = ∠CDP
Conclusions: ∠BAD = ∠CDA

Step 23:
Theorem: Parallel Lines Criteria by Alternate Interior Angles
Premises : ∠BAD = ∠CDA
Conclusions: AB || CD

Step 24:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : AB || CD
Conclusions: ∠BCD = ∠CBA, ∠ADC = ∠DAB

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BCD = ∠PCD, ∠BCD = ∠CBA, ∠CBA = ∠PBA
Conclusions: ∠PBA = ∠PCD

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DAB = ∠PAB, ∠ADC = ∠PDC, ∠ADC = ∠DAB
Conclusions: ∠PAB = ∠PDC

Step 27:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠PBA = ∠PCD, ∠PAB = ∠PDC, ∠BPA = ∠CPD
Conclusions: △ABP ~ △DCP

Step 28:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △ABP ~ △DCP
Conclusions: ∠PAB = ∠PDC, ∠BPA = ∠CPD, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p = Perimeter(△ABP) / Perimeter(△CDP), sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p = AP / DP

Step 29:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 12 = Perimeter(△ABP), sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p = Perimeter(△ABP) / Perimeter(△CDP)
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p = 12 / Perimeter(△CDP)

Step 30:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.61 = AP, 10.82 = DP, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p = AP / DP
Conclusions: 3.61 / 10.82 = sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.61 / 10.82 = sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_p_triangle_d_c_p = 12 / Perimeter(△CDP)
Conclusions: 3.61 / 10.82 = 12 / Perimeter(△CDP)

Step 32:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.61 / 10.82 = 12 / Perimeter(△CDP)
Conclusions: 36 = Perimeter(△CDP)
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(C, D, N)), MeasureOf(Angle(B, A, M)))
